medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initial evaluation noted low serum levels of sex steroids and gonadotropins, progressive ataxia, and dementia. Symptoms began in the early 1990s with erectile dysfunction, leading to infertility at age 31 and further neurological decline by age 33.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism and demonstrated progressive neurological symptoms including dysarthria and clumsy hand movements.
medical_history.family_history: The parents of the affected siblings are first cousins, indicating potential autosomal recessive inheritance.
medical_history.social_history: The family emigrated from Palestine in 1948; no other relevant social history specified.
